citations.narrative:
Protocol #21-12-404 contains an IACUC approved exception from the provisions of the AWA under Subpart B Hamsters
Facilities, Indoor - Heating. This exception to the heating standard under the AWA that affected 9 hamsters was not
reported by the research facility on their FY 24 Annual Report.
Per this Section, the annual report shall assure that the research facility is adhering to the standards and regulations
under the Act, and that exceptions to the standards and regulations be specified and explained by the principal
investigator and approved by the IACUC. A summary of all such IACUC-approved exceptions must be attached to the
facility’s annual report that includes a brief explanation of the exceptions, as well as the species and number of animals
affected. Correct by (1) submitting a corrected FY 24 Annual Report to USDA that includes a summary of the exception
with number of animals affected by 8/15/25 and (2) including any IACUC approved exceptions on future USDA annual
reports from this date 7/15/25 forward.

One Rhabdomys pumilio mouse was not handled as carefully as possible by animal care technicians during cage change
on 4/16/25. The adult mice and their 8-day old litter were transferred to a clean cage and the dirty cage/bedding was then
processed for sanitization. After the enclosure was processed, technicians found one pup was deceased. Veterinary staff
were immediately contacted and concluded that the pup was already dead when the adults and the litter were transferred
to the clean cage. This conclusion was based on the more rapid development of this species of mice after birth; 8-day old
Rhabdomys pups are active, have open eyes, are fully furred, and behave similarly to an adult.
Per this Section, the handling of animals by all personnel should be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does
not cause physical harm or unnecessary discomfort. The deceased Rhabdomys pup was not handled as carefully as
possible during cage transfer when animal care technicians did not thoroughly check the bedding of the dirty cage. This
incident was voluntarily reported to USDA and corrective measures were implemented prior to this inspection, which
included the retraining of technical staff on the cage change procedure and modifying the procedure for processing dirty
cages. No additional incidents have occurred. To remain corrected from this date 7/15/25 forward.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
